definition: to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
to exhibit one's feelings in one's speech
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place

sentences.english: The wee birdies sing and the wild flowers spring.
sentences.chinese: 鳥聲溢，鳴啾唧，野花放，遍地香。

sentences.english: Take the pan away quickly; it's boiling over.
sentences.chinese: 快把鍋子端開，裏面的東西都煮得溢出來了。

sentences.english: You have to keep watching to prevent the milk from boiling over .
sentences.chinese: 你要看住，不要讓牛奶溢出來。

sentences.english: Summer's field dip water, overflow of the color, green stack heap Tsui.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的田野蘸了水，溢了彩，堆翠疊綠的。

sentences.english: A few children crawled beneath the tanker in the hope of catching the spillage.
sentences.chinese: 幾個小孩在郵輪下面爬，希望能夠接到溢出來的水。

sentences.english: I'll use a large pot to prevent the soup from boiling over.
sentences.chinese: 我將用一個大缸，防止湯煮沸溢出來。

sentences.english: Water overruns the kettle while boiling.
sentences.chinese: 水開時從壺裏溢了出來。

sentences.english: The last drop makes the cup run over.
sentences.chinese: 滿斟之杯，溢於最後一滴。

sentences.english: The water spilt from the basin.
Tom spilled his coffee on the tablecloth.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆把咖啡溢在桌布上了。

sentences.english: The corner of the eye spills over the evasive tear up.
sentences.chinese: 眼角溢炪點點閁爍悳汨洸。

sentences.english: Water spilled out making a puddle onto the table.
sentences.chinese: 溢出來的水在桌子上形成了一個水坑。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the value of the galactography in the diagnosis of breast disease with nipple discharge.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討乳腺導管造影術在溢液性乳腺病的診斷價值。

sentences.english: I’ve seen wardrobes that are practically spilling with clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我看過那些裝的太滿到溢出來的衣櫥。

sentences.english: There the wild flowers spring and the wee birdies sing.
sentences.chinese: 野花放，遍地香，鳥聲溢，鳴啾唧。

sentences.english: Look after the milk on the stove.Don't let it bubble over.
sentences.chinese: 看好爐子上的牛奶，別讓它溢出來。

definition: to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to overflow/to ripple/used in place names/see 漾濞[Yang4 bi4]
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
